lines.text:
[after seeing the Feuhrer from his hotel balcony, he goes to the bedroom door]
Hey! Hitler is here!

[Unimpressed from behind the door]
Well I can't see him now. I'm dressing.
lines.character: Katie O'Hara Von Luber, aka Katherine Butt-Smith

lines.text: Look here, old man. Where is your patriotism?

Well, thinking of her with him isn't helping it any! And you leave my patriotism out of this. I don't mind giving up coffee and sugar but when it comes to... I'd like to know what man was ever hero enough to say I have but one wife to give to my country!
But I still don't see how a lovely creature with your possibilities could a...
You're a newspaperman?
lines.character: Katie O'Hara Von Luber, aka Katherine Butt-Smith

lines.text: Yeah.
Why?
lines.character: Katie O'Hara Von Luber, aka Katherine Butt-Smith

lines.text: That's what I wanted to be.
It's that simple. Goodbye.
lines.character: Katie O'Hara Von Luber, aka Katherine Butt-Smith

lines.text: Now, just a moment. One last look. I want to always remember you just the way you look tonight... today.

[Talking on a trans-Atlantic phone connection]
I'm gonna be married, Mama. Gee, I wish you were here. I always imagined you'd be at my wedding, Mama.
lines.character: Katie O'Hara Von Luber, aka Katherine Butt-Smith

lines.text:
[Suspiciously]
Is this a hasty marriage, Katie? What's the hurry?
Well, he comes from a long line of wealthy Austrian people, Mama, and they're all dead.
lines.character: Katie O'Hara Von Luber, aka Katherine Butt-Smith

lines.text: How did you know those guns were no good?
Well, sir, because the man who sold them to you was no good.

[Referring to Katie's objections to pre-marital sex]
My dear, I'm fully aware of the American mania for respectability.

[He takes two tickets out of his inside pocket]
Separate compartments.
Separate compartments?
lines.character: Katie O'Hara Von Luber, aka Katherine Butt-Smith

lines.text: Mmm-hmmm.
I might insist on separate trains.
lines.character: Katie O'Hara Von Luber, aka Katherine Butt-Smith

lines.text: That might be overdoing it.
General, you're innocent.
I can prove my innocence, but I can never disprove my stupidty.
Go some place where it's safe.
lines.character: Katie O'Hara Von Luber, aka Katherine Butt-Smith

lines.text: Where?

[Sitting at adjpining tables in a Paris bistro]
What'll we drink to?

[Not getting a respomse and seeing the empty glasses]
I see you've had several.
Yes, yes, I'm what is known in America as 'carrying the torch.' In fact, I've swallowed it. Got a little heartburn. Lost my girl.
Oh, that's too bad. Well, let's drink to your finding her again.
That I'll do.

[to the Baron as the German ambassador and his attache come in]
Darling, I wouldn't trust those two swastikas any farther than you could throw Goering.
lines.character: Katie O'Hara Von Luber, aka Katherine Butt-Smith

lines.text: Please, Daeling, both of these gentlemen speak English.

[Referring to Katie]
Well, then, what makes you so suspicious?
She asks so many subtle leading questions. She tries to read my mind, and if she can't read my mind, she reads my mail.

[reading]
Let's make our love song one that will live / Let's make it one to forget and forgive / As life's shadows lengthen over the years, our love will strengthen through laughter and tears. I will know your thoughts / You will know mine / Without ever a word / Without ever a sign / We will know what is deep in each other's heart / We will know, for it must be, 'till death do us part.'
lines.character: Katie O'Hara Von Luber, aka Katherine Butt-Smith

lines.text: Not so loud? I always talk loud when I'm mad! You're lucky I don't jump up and down! It's things like this that can make a man a... a... a Republican!
